data.event: St Margaret's Church (built 1839â€“41, architect: John Brown) is the burial place of three Astronomers Royal: Edmond Halley, Nathaniel Bliss and John Pond.
The Manor of Lee was a historic parish of the Blackheath hundred and existed up to 1900 when it was merged with the parish of Lewisham to create the Metropolitan Borough of Lewisham.

event.title: was based around Lee High Road which today

data.event: While modern Lee is centred on Lee railway station and the road of Burnt Ash Hill, the parish was based around Lee High Road which today stretches into the town centre of Lewisham.

event.title: formed much of the boundary between the two parishes, though at Lee Bridge (at the western end of Lee High Road) it is now

data.event: The River Quaggy formed much of the boundary between the two parishes, though at Lee Bridge (at the western end of Lee High Road) it is now almost completely hidden.
The earliest map available (Rocque's of 1740) shows a cluster of about a dozen houses around a triangular village green.
